intro: Allium subkopetdagense, commonly known as the Kopetdag garlic, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous structure and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale purple flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical studies and potential horticultural use.
